Excutive Summary, The City of Cumming Risk Management Plan:
FOR SAFE CHLORINE HANDLING INVOLVES A UNIFIED EFFORT, INTEGRATING MODERN TECHNOLGY
PROCEDURES AND MANAGEMENT PRACTCIES TO MONITOR POTENTIAL CHLORINE HAZARDS AND
MINIMIZE THE RISK OF ACCIDENTAL CHLORINE RELEASES. ALL APPLICABLE PROCEDURES OF 
40 CER 68.170 ARE ADDRESSED IN THIS RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN, WHICH SEEKS TO PRODUCE FOR
EMPLOOYEE SAFETY, PUBLIC HEALTH AND RESPONSE AGENCY INTERACTION.

THE CITY OF CUMMING WATER TREATMENT PLANT DRAWS WATER FROM LAKE LANIER. 6 TREATED
(FINISHED) WATER PUMPS SERVES THE RESIDENTS IN THE CITY OF CUMMING AND NEIGHBORING AREAS
IN FORSYTH COUNTY. THE RAW WATER AND FINISHED WATER ARE DISINFECTED WITH CHLORINE. THE CHLORINATION PROCESS USES CHLORINE CYLINDERS (TON CONTAINERS), CHLORINATION EQUIPMENT RELEVANT 
INSTRUMENTATION, ELECTRIC AND PROCESS SAFETY EQUIPMENT.

THE "WORST CASE" SCENARIO; AS DEFINED BY U.S.EPA.STATES THAT "THE OWNER OR OPERATOR
SHALL ASSUME THAT THE MAXIMUM QUANTITY IN THE LARGEST  VESSEL IS RELEASED AS A GAS OVER 10 MINUTES. "ALTERNATATIVE SCENARO" IS DEFINED AS "MORE LIKEY TO OCCUR THEN THE WORST CASE RELEASE 
SCENARIO" A REVIEW OF THE LAST INCIDENT HISTORY FOR THE FACILITY WAS MADE AND FOUND THAT THERE WAS NO ACCIDENT RELEASE OF CHLORINE GAS FOR THE LAST FIVE YEARS OR MORE.

THE CITY OF CUMMING WATER PRODUCTION FACILTY IS LOCATED IN AN AREA WITH FEW BUILDINGS
OR OTHER OBSTRUCTIONS AND SO IT IS ASSUMEED AS RURAL CONDITIONS. THE GUIDANCE ASSUMES METEOROLOGICAL CONDITIONS FOR THE WORST CASE SCENARIO OF ATMOSPHERE STABILTY CLASS "F"
( STABLE ATMOSPHERE) AND WIND SPEED 1.5 METERS PER SECOND (3.4 MILES PER HOUR) AMBIENT AIR TEMPERATURE IS ASSUMED FOR THE WORST CASE, AS PER GUIDANCE, EVEN IF THE MAXIMUM TEMPERATURE, AT THIS LOCATION IN THE LAST THREE YEARS WAS HIGHER.

THE WORST CASE RELEASE SCENARIO FOR THIS FACILITY INVOLVES A FAILURE OF AN ONE TON CYLINDER
YEILD OF A CUMULATIVE RELEASE OF 2000 POUNDS OF CHLORINE. WHEN THE ATOMOSPHERIC DISPERSION MODELING FOR TH

IS UNLIKEYLY SCENARIO WAS PERFORMED USING YHE EPA GUIDENCE DOCUMENT, A DISTANCE TO TOXIC END POINT OF 3.0 MILES WAS OBTAINED.

THE ALTERNATIVE RELEASE (MORE LIKELY) SCENARIO FOR CHLORINATION PROCESS INVOLVES MECHANCIAL FAILURE OF ONE FLEXIBLE MAINIFOLD CONNECTION (PIGTAIL) ALLOWING THE ACCIDENTAL RELEASE OF ONE TON CYLINDER OF CHLORINE OVER AN ONE HOUR PERIOD.

AS PER EPA GUIDANCE (SIMILAR ATMOSPHERIC MODELING) YEILDS A MORE LIKELY FIGURE OF 0.36 MILE AFFECTED RADIUS UNDER NORMAL ATMOSPHERIC CODITIONS AT FACILITY SITE.

THE CITY OF CUMMING RISK MANAGEMENT PROGRAM OR PLAN INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING SALIENT FACTORS TO MITIGATE THE EFFECTS OF POTENTIAL CHLORINE RELEASE. 
OPERATOR TRAINING FOR NORMAL OPERATION AS WELL AS FOR EMERGENCY SITUATIONS ON A REGULAR BASIS.
PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE PROGRAM.
SFETY EQUIPMENT.
SAFE AND EFFECTIVE STANDARD AND PROCEDURES, WRITTEN WITH THE OPERATOR PARTICIPATION.
HAZARD REVIEW OF EQUIPMENT AND PROCEDURES ON A REGULAR BASIS.
AUDITING AN INSPECTION PROGRAMS.
COMPREHENSIVE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM.

THE CITY OF CUMMING WATER PRODUCTION DEPARTMENT HAS AN ACTIVE HEALTH AND SAFETY PROCEDURE AND PROGRAM WITH THE BELOW MENTIONED SUPPORTING FOR SAFE HANDLING OF CHLORINE AND CHLOINTION PROCESS:
CHEMICAL RIGHT TO KNOW PRGRAM.
CHLORINE DETECTORS.
ALARM SYSTEM.
RESPIRATORY PROTECTION (SCBA) PRORAM.
PERSONAL PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT.

THE CITY OF CUMMING WATER PRODUCTION DEPARTMENT AND THE FORSYTH COUNTY FIRE DEPARTMENT HAVE AN EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN. THE WATER PRODUCTION DEPARTMENT IS TAKING ALL POSTIVE AND PROACTIVE APPROACH TO RISK MANAGEMENT AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE THROUGH TRAINING SESSIONS AND 
CONTINUOUSLY MAINTAIN EFFECTIVE PROCEDURE, FOR THE SAFE HANDLING AND TIMELY RESPONSE FOR 
ANY POTENTIAL CHLORINE LEAK.
